subclassFeatures.name: Oath of Rebirth
entries: The Oath or Rebirth calls to paladins that believe that the forces of Good can never truly be defeated, and that hope can be given up, but cannot be killed. Sometimes called phoenix warriors, eternal lights or ash knights, these paladins wield the power of the immortal flame of faith into battle, inspiring the righteous as shining beacons of hope and consuming their enemies with cleansing fire. They serve the forces of Good with burning fury, and do not hesitate to destroy anything that opposes them, in hopes of purifying the unjust to start afresh once again. Those who swear this oath often adorn their armors and clothing with symbols of hope and immortality, like red feathers or sunrises, to reflect their unshakable faith in the providence.

entries.name: Tenets of Rebirth
entries: Tenets of Rebirth have been the same since the times of the first phoenix warriors. They are passed on orally, and most of these paladins know them by heart. They emphasize the principles of everlasting hope, righteousness and courage.

entries.name: Become The Guiding Light.
entries: Personally take charge of actions against the forces of Evil. Inspire and lead your companions into battle with burning fervor.

entries.name: Be Ready To Sacrifice.
entries: Do not fear death, for your spirit will live on in the heart of your righteous companions; let your last, heroic act be an inspiration for those who falter.

entries.name: Burn To Rebuild From The Ashes.
entries: Often, you cannot redeem those who have lost the righteous path. Destroy those who oppose the forces of Good with your sacred fire, and let them start afresh from their own ashes.

entries.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Dauntless Spirit
entries: As a bonus action, you can use your Channel Divinity to challenge death itself.
For 1 minute, you and every ally within 30 feet of you have advantage on death saving throws.

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Fervor of Battle
entries: As an action, you can use your Channel Divinity to develop an incredible fighting endurance.
For 1 minute, every time you deal damage with a melee weapon attack, you recover hit points equal to half your Charisma modifier (rounded up, minimum of 1).

entries.name: Aura of Fortitude
entries: Starting at 7th level, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you gain temporary hit points equal to half your Charisma modifier (rounded up, minimum of 1) at the start of each of your turns.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet, and the temporary hit points you grant with this feature are equal to your Charisma modifier instead.

entries.name: Through the Flames
entries: Starting at 15th level, you no longer age. Also, each time you or a friendly creature within 30 feet of you suffers fire damage, you can use your reaction to give that creature immunity to fire damage until the start of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended charges after a long rest.

entries.name: Eternal Crusader
entries: At 20th level, you learn how to unleash the spirit of the phoenix, assuming the form of an immortal winged warrior. Using your action, you undergo a transformation. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:
Wings of fire sprout from your back and grant you a flying speed of 60 feet.
Your melee weapon attacks deals 1d6 bonus fire damage, and ignore fire resistance.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can choose to spend a hit dice. If you do, you drop to 1 hit point instead, and recover hit points equal to 10 + your Constitution modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
